issue.title: shockwave.org

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Social Widget) [https://shockwave.org/contact/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fshockwave.org%2Fcontact%2F) ### Comment Username: @pleasantone > In the social rules (blocking-content-rules-social.json), there is the entry: > > "action":{"type":"css-display-none","selector":"#mc_embed_signup"}} > > This selector exists because we are displaying a page that lets users sign up for our mailing list, hosted by MailChimp. This is not a social-networking icon in the slightest. Not sure how it ever got in here, but this feels like a bug. The javascript involved does no tracking (on our site) and doesn't bring in any external cookies or any other weirdness. I think someone jumped the gun here. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://reports-img.adguard.com/AZxZQ6Q.png)
### System configuration Information | value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard for Safari v1.11.10 Browser: | Safari Filters: | Ad Blocking:
AdGuard Base,
AdGuard Mobile Ads

Privacy:
AdGuard Tracking Protection

Social Widgets:
AdGuard Social Media

Annoyances:
AdGuard Annoyances Other extensions used: | Just safari.

comment.body:
You are correct. My bad, it’s part of the annoyances filter.

It is possible for MailChimp to throw widgets on the side, which I agree is an annoyance, if configured by the website owner, but the current mc_embed_signup is over-broad and triggers when inappropriate. Please advise.
On Feb 10, 2023 at 2:32 AM -0800, Alex ***@***.***>, wrote:
> This element is blocked by AdGuard Annoyances (or by a part of this filter - AdGuard Popups filter), which is not enabled by default, not by a social filter.
> —

> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.Message ID: ***@***.***>

issue.title: scmagazine.com
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for Android

### AdGuard version

3.6.54

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc.

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Microsoft Edge

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://www.scmagazine.com/news/malware/phishing-screenshots-payload-delivery

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, AdGuard URL Tracking filter, AdGuard Social Media filter, AdGuard Annoyances filter, Fanboy's Anti-Facebook List, Legitimate URL Shortener

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

Screenshots

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).
